April 2h, 1956
Mr* Theodore Beckmeyer
Route 3
Snohomish, Washington
Dear Mr* Beckmeyer:
Your order for several NAEB publications has been received and the publi¬
cations mailed. You also asked us to send any other materials dealing with
the use of educational television in the classroom* I»m sorry, but all the
materials we have for distribution are those indicated in the materials
available list you already have.
You also requested information regarding membership in the Association.
The NA'B has three categories of membership, as follows:
Active - Educational institutions, public service organizations, etc.
owning and operating their own radio and/or television sta¬
tions.
Associate - Institutions (as above) not owning stations, but operating
PtfSduction centers and regularly producing programs over a
commercial outlet.
Affiliate - Any organization or individual interested in the general
furtherance of educational broadcasting.
For Active members with radio stations, dues in the association are based
on rated transmitter power, as follows:
Class A - 5 kw and over - $50.00
Class B - 1 - U.9 kw - 25*00
Class C - less than 1 kw - 15.00
Television stations with less than 5 kw video power pay $50.00 and those
with 5 kw or more video power pay f100.00.
Associate and Affiliate members pay SlO.OO a year. For this fee members
receive our monthly Newsletter; the various reports and surveys we publish
periodically! services of ourPlacement Service, television engineer, legal
counsel, management consultant, etc.; plus the normal day-to-day services.
